abstract: California remains vigilant over water supply, even after rescinding restrictive measures on urban water use following wet winter, and may impose statewide curbs if drier-than-normal conditions return; many fear drought is likely to happen again given reports that Lake Mead reservoir water level has reached historic low and that La Nina weather pattern, which will bring dry winter, is predicted by fall.
lead_paragraph: After a relatively wet winter that eased fears of shortages, drier conditions may return to the state, both for the short and long term.

headline.main: The Winter Was Wet, but California Could Get Thirsty Again
headline.print_headline: A Wet Winter, but California May Still Get Thirsty

snippet: After a relatively wet winter that eased fears of shortages, drier conditions may return to the state, both for the short and long term.
